commit.message:
Add -t option to toggle modes

Signed-off-by: Paul Meyer <49727155+katexochen@users.noreply.github.com>
Move man pages to doc/ subdir
Define _POSIX_C_SOURCE globally
Use mako_asprintf() in notification_execute_binding()

Drop wordexp() usage in get_config_path()

wordexp() produces multiple words (doesn't play nice with whitespace)
and may invoke a shell.

Destroy the frame callback in `destroy_surface`

Otherwise the surface can be used in the callback after being freed.

Avoid double-destroying the frame callback

`surface->frame_callback` could have already been destroyed in
`layer_surface_handle_closed`, and calling wl_callback_destory with NULL
segfaults.
Allow dismissing notif without adding it to history

Implement wp_cursor_shape_v1

Co-authored-by: Simon Ser <contact@emersion.fr>
Check wl_display_roundtrip() errors
Replace xdg-output with wl_output v4
build: require wayland-scanner v1.14.91
build: use pkg-config to find wayland-scanner
build: drop intermediate static lib for protocols
build: use add_project_arguments() for define

build: drop unnecessary define values

We just #ifdef these.
Remove unused includes

readme: basu needs a manual dbus user session

A manually started dbus user session is not only needed for elogind, but for
basu too. In other words, any environment not using systemd might need it.

render: fix segfault

The notification style was being accessed after destroying the
notification struct.
man: re-format lists in criteria
man: improve binding docs
build: bump version to 1.8.0
Fix positioning of text being offset by border size

Fix positioning of icon

The right, top and bottom cases had incorrect calculations for the
position of the icon.

Right: `style->margin.right` was used instead of `style->padding.right`
Top: `style->padding.top` was not added
Bottom: `style->margin.bottom` was used instead of
`style->padding.bottom`, and `style->border_size` was not taken into
account

The left case had the correct calculation, but could be simplified.

Check icon name before pass it to glob()

Closes: https://github.com/emersion/mako/issues/456

commit.message:
Add invoke-action <action>

Before this patch, it was impossible to send a different action
than `default` when clicking on a notification without loosing
access to the surface and thus the xdg_activation token.

With this patch, the user is now able to configure the action
to be sent when clicking on the notification while preserving
access to the xdg_activation token.

Example configuration:
```ini
[app-name="some-app-id" actionable]
on-button-left=invoke-action mail-reply-sender
```
Add urgency indicator in makoctl list.
makoctl: add command to list history
fix segfault when surface->surface_output is NULL
Add desktop-entry to `makoctl list`
